name: All static fields in the enterprise bean class should be declared as final
description:
An enterprise bean must not use read/write static fields. Using read-only static fields is allowed. Therefore, it is recommended that all static fields in the enterprise bean class be declared as final.


This rule reports all enterprise beans (session, message and entity) that have non final static fields even if these static fields are held by a class in its inheritance tree.
output:
This report lists all java enterprise classes that have non final static fields.
It provides the following information:
 - Class full name
 - list of non final static fields
rationale:
An object contains a public static field that is not marked final, which might allow it to be modified in unexpected ways.
This rule is required to ensure consistent runtime semantics because while some EJB containers may use a single JVM to execute all enterprise bean's instances, others may distribute the instances across
multiple JVMs.
reference:
JSR-220 Enterprise Java Beans 3.0 Final Release (ejbcore) page 545
https://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/restrictions-142267.html
remediation: Declare these static fields as final or review your design.
total: Number of enterprise beans (session, message and entity)
alternativeName: Ensure to have all static fields in the enterprise bean class be declared as final.
